Use Case: Making an existing layout look more professional and polished
Prompt: Review the current design and refine it to look more professional. Focus on: consistent spacing (use 8px grid system), proper visual hierarchy, balanced white space, refined typography (proper font weights and sizes), cohesive color application, and overall polish. Make it feel more premium without changing the core layout.
Description/Notes: Comprehensive refinement prompt that elevates existing designs to professional quality. Use when your page works but needs visual polish.

Use Case: Improving visual hierarchy in an existing design
Prompt: Analyze the current page and improve the visual hierarchy. Create clear distinction between primary, secondary, and tertiary elements. Adjust font sizes, weights, colors, and spacing to guide the user's eye naturally through the content. Ensure the most important elements stand out appropriately.
Description/Notes: Fixes common hierarchy issues where everything looks equally important. Essential for improving readability and user flow.

Use Case: Refining color scheme consistency across pages
Prompt: Audit the current color usage and create a consistent, professional color system. Ensure proper contrast ratios (WCAG AA minimum), use colors purposefully (primary for actions, secondary for support, neutrals for content), eliminate random color choices, and create a cohesive palette throughout all pages.
Description/Notes: Establishes color consistency which is crucial for professional appearance. Use when colors feel random or inconsistent.

Use Case: Polishing typography across the entire site
Prompt: Refine all typography to create a cohesive, professional type system. Set clear heading hierarchy (H1-H6), body text styles, optimal line heights (1.5-1.7 for body), appropriate letter spacing, consistent font weights, and proper paragraph spacing. Use maximum 2-3 font families. Make text scannable and elegant.
Description/Notes: Typography is 95% of web design. This prompt creates professional, readable text throughout your site.

Prompt: Review all spacing and alignment across the site. Implement consistent padding/margins using an 8px or 4px grid system. Fix alignment issues, ensure elements line up properly, create balanced white space, and remove cramped or overly spacious areas. Make the design feel intentional and well-structured.
Description/Notes: Proper spacing is what separates amateur from professional design. Use this to create breathing room and structure.

Use Case: Enhancing button and CTA design consistency
Prompt: Refine all buttons and CTAs for consistency and impact. Create clear primary, secondary, and tertiary button styles. Ensure proper sizing (min 44x44px for mobile), consistent hover/active states, appropriate spacing, clear visual distinction, and compelling design that encourages clicks.
Description/Notes: CTAs drive conversions. This ensures your buttons look professional and consistent throughout the site.

Use Case: Polishing form design and user inputs
Prompt: Review and refine all forms and input fields. Ensure: proper field sizing, clear labels, helpful placeholder text, obvious focus states, error state styling, success feedback, consistent styling across all forms, proper spacing, and a user-friendly experience. Make forms feel modern and trustworthy.
Description/Notes: Forms are friction points. Polish them to reduce abandonment and increase completion rates.

Use Case: Refining card components and content blocks
Prompt: Audit and enhance all card components and content blocks. Create consistent card styles with: proper shadows or borders, balanced internal spacing, aligned content, clear hierarchies within cards, consistent sizing, hover effects, and professional appearance. Ensure cards feel like a cohesive system.
Description/Notes: Cards are common UI patterns. Consistent, polished cards make your entire site feel more professional.

Prompt: Refine the navigation menu for clarity and usability. Ensure: clear active states, proper hover effects, logical grouping, mobile-friendly design, sufficient click targets, clear visual hierarchy, professional styling, and intuitive structure. Make navigation feel effortless.
Description/Notes: Navigation is your site's map. Polish it to help users find what they need quickly and confidently.

Use Case: Refining footer design and information architecture
Prompt: Polish the footer to look professional and organized. Include: logical link grouping, social media icons, contact info, clear visual separation from main content, proper spacing, trust signals (copyright, privacy policy), newsletter signup if applicable, and cohesive styling that matches the site.
Description/Notes: Footers often get neglected but are important for trust and navigation. Make yours professional and complete.

Prompt: Review and refine all icon usage. Ensure: consistent icon style (all outline OR all filled, not mixed), appropriate sizing, proper alignment with text, meaningful icon choices, consistent stroke weights, professional appearance, and clear association with their labels or functions.
Description/Notes: Mixed icon styles look unprofessional. This creates icon consistency that feels intentional and polished.

Prompt: Enhance how images are displayed throughout the site. Apply: consistent border radius, professional shadows or frames, proper aspect ratios, lazy loading, alt text, responsive sizing, quality optimization, and cohesive styling. Ensure images enhance rather than detract from the design.
Description/Notes: Images should feel integrated into your design system, not like random insertions.

Use Case: Refining section breaks and page flow
Prompt: Improve how sections transition and flow on each page. Add: subtle dividers or background changes, consistent section spacing, clear visual breaks between content areas, rhythm and pacing, and smooth visual flow that guides users naturally down the page.
Description/Notes: Good section flow creates a pleasant scrolling experience and keeps users engaged.

Prompt: Audit and improve contrast throughout the site. Ensure: text meets WCAG AA standards (4.5:1 for normal text, 3:1 for large), important elements stand out, subtle elements recede appropriately, no eye strain, and clear distinction between interactive and non-interactive elements.
Description/Notes: Proper contrast is crucial for accessibility and professional appearance. Fixes washed-out or hard-to-read designs.

Prompt: Refine dark mode implementation for a professional look. Ensure: true blacks are avoided (use dark grays), proper contrast ratios, reduced eye strain, consistent elevation with subtle highlights, smooth transitions between themes, and all elements work beautifully in dark mode.
Description/Notes: Dark mode done wrong looks amateurish. This polishes it for professional quality and eye comfort.

Prompt: Review and improve responsive behavior at all breakpoints. Ensure: smooth transitions between sizes, no awkward in-between states, consistent spacing at each size, readable text at all viewports, properly sized touch targets on mobile, and a cohesive experience across all devices.
Description/Notes: Responsive design should feel intentional at every size, not just desktop and mobile. This fills the gaps.

Prompt: Design professional loading and empty states. Create: skeleton screens for loading, helpful empty state messages with clear next actions, consistent styling with the main design, branded illustrations or icons, and states that maintain user confidence and reduce perceived wait time.
Description/Notes: These in-between states are often overlooked but crucial for perceived performance and user experience.

Use Case: Polishing table design and data presentation
Prompt: Refine all tables and data displays for clarity and professionalism. Implement: proper column headers, zebra striping or subtle row separators, responsive table behavior, proper alignment (numbers right, text left), sortable headers if applicable, and clean, scannable design.
Description/Notes: Tables can look clunky. This makes them clean, professional, and easy to scan.

Prompt: Polish all modals, dialogs, and popups. Ensure: proper backdrop/overlay, clear close buttons, mobile-friendly sizing, appropriate animations (fade in/slide up), focus management, logical button order (primary action on right), and professional appearance that doesn't feel jarring.
Description/Notes: Modals interrupt the user flow, so they must be polished, clear, and user-friendly.

Use Case: Enhancing dropdown and select menu design
Prompt: Refine all dropdown menus and select elements. Create: clear open/closed states, proper hover highlighting, sufficient padding, easy-to-read options, smooth open/close animations, mobile-friendly touch targets, and professional styling consistent with your design system.
Description/Notes: Dropdowns should feel smooth and professional, not clunky. Essential for forms and navigation.

Prompt: Refine all notifications, alerts, and toast messages. Implement: clear success/error/warning/info states with appropriate colors, proper icons, dismissible design, appropriate timing (3-5s for success, manual close for errors), non-intrusive positioning, and consistent styling.
Description/Notes: Notifications communicate important info. Make them clear, professional, and appropriately styled.

Prompt: Polish all badges, tags, and labels throughout the site. Ensure: consistent sizing, clear color coding (if used), appropriate contrast, proper spacing, professional pill or rounded rectangle shapes, and meaningful visual distinction from surrounding content.
Description/Notes: Badges add context but can look cluttered if not refined. This creates clean, professional tags.

Prompt: Refine progress bars, step indicators, and process flows. Create: clear current state highlighting, completed vs. upcoming distinction, progress percentage if applicable, smooth animations, professional styling, and clear visual feedback that builds user confidence.
Description/Notes: Progress indicators reduce anxiety in multi-step processes. Make them clear and encouraging.

Prompt: Enhance testimonial and review sections for trust and professionalism. Include: proper quote styling, clear attribution with photos if available, rating displays (stars), dates if relevant, consistent card design, credible formatting, and layout that makes testimonials feel authentic and impactful.
Description/Notes: Testimonials build trust. Polish them to look credible and professional, not fake or forced.

Prompt: Polish pricing tables and plan comparisons. Ensure: clear feature lists, highlighted recommended plans, proper alignment, scannable design, compelling CTAs, proper spacing, mobile-friendly stacking, clear price emphasis, and professional appearance that drives conversions.
Description/Notes: Pricing tables directly impact revenue. Make them clear, scannable, and conversion-focused.

Prompt: Refine team member displays and about sections. Create: consistent photo styling (shape, size, filters), clear role labels, professional layout (grid or cards), social links, balanced spacing, and design that makes the team look credible and approachable.
Description/Notes: Team pages build trust and personality. Polish them for professional yet approachable appearance.

Prompt: Enhance blog post and article layouts for optimal readability. Implement: optimal line length (50-75 characters), comfortable line height, clear heading hierarchy, proper paragraph spacing, styled blockquotes, code block formatting if needed, and professional typography that encourages reading.
Description/Notes: Long-form content needs careful typography. This creates an enjoyable, professional reading experience.

Prompt: Polish search bars and results pages. Create: clear input design with search icon, autocomplete suggestions if applicable, professional results layout, highlighting of search terms, empty state for no results, loading states, and intuitive, fast-feeling search experience.
Description/Notes: Search is critical for user navigation. Make it feel fast, professional, and helpful.

Use Case: Enhancing video and media player integration
Prompt: Refine embedded videos and media players. Ensure: proper aspect ratios (16:9), custom controls if applicable, professional thumbnail images, smooth loading, proper sizing across devices, accessible controls, and integration that feels native to your design.
Description/Notes: Video players should feel integrated, not like iframe afterthoughts. Polish them for cohesive design.

Prompt: Refine accordion menus and collapsible content sections. Create: clear open/closed indicators, smooth expand/collapse animations, proper spacing, professional styling, clear headers, and intuitive behavior that makes content exploration feel natural and organized.
Description/Notes: Accordions help organize content without overwhelming users. Make them smooth and professional.

Use Case: Refining tab navigation and content switching
Prompt: Polish tabbed interfaces and content switchers. Ensure: clear active tab indication, proper hover states, smooth content transitions, consistent styling, mobile-friendly behavior, logical tab order, and professional appearance that makes navigation obvious.
Description/Notes: Tabs organize related content. Make them clear and easy to use with professional styling.

Prompt: Refine breadcrumb trails for better navigation. Create: clear hierarchy display, clickable links, proper separators (/ or >), appropriate sizing and positioning, mobile behavior, and subtle styling that helps without cluttering the design.
Description/Notes: Breadcrumbs help users understand site structure. Make them clear but unobtrusive.

Use Case: Polishing stat counters and metrics displays
Prompt: Enhance number displays, stat counters, and key metrics sections. Use: large, bold numbers, clear labels, appropriate animations (count-up effects), professional layout (grid or cards), proper units, and design that makes numbers impactful and credible.
Description/Notes: Numbers and stats prove value. Display them prominently with professional design that builds credibility.

Prompt: Polish all tooltips and popovers throughout the site. Ensure: appropriate timing (appear on hover after 0.5s), clear arrow pointing to trigger, dark background with light text or vice versa, concise helpful text, proper positioning that doesn't go off-screen, and smooth fade in/out.
Description/Notes: Tooltips provide helpful context. Make them clear, well-timed, and visually polished.

Prompt: Refine sidebar navigation and auxiliary menus. Create: clear hierarchy, collapsible sections if needed, proper active state highlighting, professional styling, smooth show/hide behavior on mobile, consistent with main navigation, and helpful organization that aids discovery.
Description/Notes: Sidebars provide secondary navigation. Polish them for clarity and professional appearance.

Prompt: Enhance error pages for a better user experience. Include: clear error message, helpful next steps or navigation, search bar if applicable, branded illustration or image, consistent styling with main site, touch of personality, and design that maintains trust even when things go wrong.
Description/Notes: Error pages are opportunities to maintain brand trust. Make them helpful and on-brand, not generic.

Use Case: Comprehensive design audit and polish pass
Prompt: Perform a complete design audit and refinement pass across the entire site. Review: spacing consistency, color usage, typography, component styling, alignment, visual hierarchy, responsive behavior, and overall cohesion. Fix inconsistencies, enhance weak areas, and elevate the entire site to a professional, polished standard. Document any design system decisions.
Description/Notes: Final comprehensive polish prompt. Use this for a thorough review and refinement of the entire site before launch.
